com.avaya.csta.binding

Class SelectiveStreamRequest

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.ecma.csta.CastorObject
      • com.avaya.csta.binding.SelectiveStreamRequest
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class SelectiveStreamRequest
extends ch.ecma.csta.CastorObject
implements java.io.Serializable
    Used to control the media stream of the registered terminal. A terminal will be able to request any combination of talking parties present on the call to be included or excluded in the presented media stream. The content of each recorder port stream is independent of the content on any other recorder port stream.

    To use StreamContent.SELCTIVE_INCLUDE and StreamContent.SELECTIVE_EXCLUDE values for StreamContent, application has to know the parties present in a call in advance before requesting selective stream. Application can get parties present in call using following two ways: 1) Using EstablishedEvent from CallControlListener: Register for EstablishedEvent for a DMCC device in advance before registration of a device. As soon as DMCC device gets added in call, application will receive an event containing the devices present in call. Application can store devices present in call and use it to request split media stream whenever required. 2) Using snapshot services: Before requesting selective stream for a DMCC device, snapshot service can be used to get information about devices present in call. Application can store devices present in call and use it to request split media stream whenever required.

    If you wish to use StreamContent.MAIN_STATION or StreamContent.ALL_BUT_MAIN_STATION options in SelectiveStreamRequest, and if a main-station of a DMCC shared device is not present in the call CM will ignore SelectiveStreamRequest without taking any action. Because there is no main-station/party available in a call against which CM can take decision for media stream filtering.

    If you want to use SLH/SLR along with 1PCC SelectiveStreamRequest. SSR will always have precendence over SLH/SLR/Privacy Muting or other features and all these features will work only when party is in filtered list after SelectiveStreamRequest.

    If there is a problem with the request, an exception is thrown.

    Since the RegistrationServices.selectiveStream is a synchronous call, this request will block while waiting for a response. If it is desirable that the application thread be able to continue processing while waiting for the response, consider using AsynchronousServices (Java API only) to process the SelectiveStreamRequest. The SelectiveStreamRequest request has these parameters:

    RedirectMediaRequest Parameters
    device Mandatory Unique identifier of phone/extension that was originally registered.
    streamContent Mandatory This field indicates which type of content should be included in media stream. It is mandatory to specify DMCC devices when StreamContent.SELECTIVE_INCLUDE or StreamContent.SELECTIVE_EXCLUDE option is chosen for streamContent. There are various possible options which can be set for the field are described below.
    StreamContent.FULL Setting this option removes removes any filtering of the media stream. All parties present in the call are presented in a fully summed conference stream.
    StreamContent.MAIN_STATION_ONLY Setting this option forces the media stream to include only the shared extension device with the current role of talker. This is usually the main station/agent.
    StreamContent.ALL_BUT_MAIN_STATION Setting this option forces the media stream to exclude the shared extension device with the current role of talker. This is usually the main station/agent. The media stream includes all other talking parties and any parties subsequently added to the call.
    StreamContent.SELECTIVE_INCLUDE Setting this option will allow a DMCC device to specifically request one or more parties in the call be included in the media stream transmitted to the requesting DMCC device. Parties whose media to be included in stream of a DMCC device should be specified in selectivePartyList.
    StreamContent.SELECTIVE_EXCLUDE Setting this option will allow a DMCC device to specifically request one or more parties in the call be excluded from the media stream transmitted to the requesting DMCC device. Parties whose media to be included in stream of a DMCC device should be specified in selectivePartyList.
    selectivePartyList Conditional Specify one or more parties in the call be included or excluded in the media stream transmitted to the requesting DMCC device. selectivePartyList is only effective when streamContent is set to StreamContent.SELECTIVE_INCLUDE or StreamContent.SELECTIVE_EXCLUDE. Based on streamContent value Communication Manager will use selectivePartyList to construct the media stream for requesting DMCC device.

    A device in selectivePartyList can have two forms: 1) An extension e.g. 12345678:CM123:10.10.10.10:0, where 12345678 is extension present on CM123. 2) A trunk group and member e.g. T123#45:CM123:10.10.10.10:0, where 123 is callid of a call where this device is present in call on CM123, and 45 is partyid of the device in call. This information is usually represented in trunkGroup and trunkMember fields in EstablishedEvent or SnapshotDeviceResponse.

    mediaTonesAnnc Optional Use this option to specify whether system generated tones and announcements shall be included or excluded from the recorder stream. Setting this field to FALSE will exclude tones and announcements from media stream. Setting this field to TRUE will include tones and announcements from media stream, which is default behavior when the field mediaTonesAnnc is not specified.

    The SelectiveStreamResponse indicates the outcome of the request.

    Negative Acknowledgements:

    • operation:invalidDeviceID - Sent if there is no station associated with the device ID specified.
    • stateIncompatibility:invalidDeviceState - Sent if the device is in the wrong state.
    • operation:invalidParameterValue - Sent if the request is NULL.
    • operation:generic - Sent if there is an operation error such as a socket IO error.
    • unspecified - Sent an implementation-specific error occurs.
    Version:
    $Revision$ $Date$
    See Also:
    Serialized Form
